Academics

24 Jun 2022

I am an undergraduate student @ UC Berkeley majoring in Computer Science.

Expected graduation: fall 22

Some course recommendations:

I really enjoy studying CS at Berkeley. Most of Berkeleyâ€™s CS undergrad materials are fully open-sourced, so you can learn them any time you like. Here is a selection of the tech courses I took, along with their websites and official notes (if any).

Technical

  • MATH 53: Multivariable Calculus [MIT-Open-Course]
  • MATH 113: Introduction to Abstract Algebra [official_notes]
  • EECS 16A: Designing Information Devices and Systems I [website]
  • CS 61A: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs [website]
  • CS 61B: Data Structures [website]
  • CS 61C: Great Ideas in Computer Architecture (Machine Structures) [website]
  • CS 70: Discrete Mathematics and Probability Theory [website][official_notes]
  • CS 161: Computer Security [website][textbook]
  • CS 188: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence [website][official_notes]

Non-technical

  • PHILOS 12A: Introduction to Logic [official_notes]
